Nominate and Vote for Your Favorite VPS Provider on LowEndTalk!

November 24, 2010 @ 12:08 am, by LowEndAdmin

abdelhalim asked this question on LowEndTalk beta:

I’m interested to get a VPS box to host some git repos + probably mail server in future, and I was looking for ranking for the VPS providers mentioned on lowendtalk, but I couldn’t find any.

Can someone points me to that if it exist, or just give me recommendation for something that is reliable and not expensive?

Sorry for taking your genuine question and making it into something else, Abdel! Instead of people suggesting a VPS provider to suit his need, how about we use the voting feature on OSQA to have regular Low End VPS provider recommendations? Instead of me creating a big table and listing out hosting providers that pays me the most (hey I can see GoDaddy, BlueHost and HostGator there!) It is your turn to recommend your fellow community members a fast, stable and cheap VPS.

I am planning to run it regularly but not as often as once per month — maybe once per quarter. For now, head down to the current recommendation discussion topic, and

  • Check whether the provider has already been nominated. If it hasn’t…
  • Each individual can nominate ONE provider. Make it an “Answer” to this discussion topic. Please include
    • The name of the provider on the first line + their “low end VPS package” that you recommend (optional)
    • The reason why you wish to nominate this provider and its VPS package.
  • Discussion of that provider can be added as comments to that Answer.
  • If your preferred provider has already been nominated, then VOTE IT UP!
  • As the Answers are sorted by votes by default, the winner (most recommended provider) will stay at top.

Let’s just give this model a try first and see how it works out.

Also please DO NOT post referral/affiliation links (which is the main thing that ruins all these web hosting review sites).
